Yet longing only have I found,
my kindred gone, my line undone.
Lost upon this hollow land,
beneath an unfamiliar sun.

And through the eastern Elónwod
sing lonely whispers beyond my ken,
which haunt me as I questing roam
to find some once remembered glen.
...the winds wave now uncaring hands.

No more the august realm of old,
This sundered sward, these tainted lands
where once kind zephyrs gaily played,...

O Melynlas! Beloved realm
of Ennös' grace, I can recall
your mighty heart, now gone away
to gentle lie with Felligal.
